numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice that the income of a parent can be larger.
2. If the income of a parent is larger then the chance of admission of an applicant is higher.
3. I notice that some kids have a relative who attended a college before them.
4. If a kid has a relative who attended a college before then the chance of admission of the kid is higher.
5. I wonder which colleges are included.
6. I wonder what the test scores are.
7. I wonder what the result is if we compare the result by race.
8. I wonder what the result is if we compare the result by citizenship status.
9. A person can come from a family in the 90th income percentile.
10. A person can be a legacy student.
11. I wonder whether coming from a family in the 90th income percentile gives more advantage than being a legacy student.
12. I wonder how the result compares year by year.
13. This situation impacts the community.
14. A person can want to get into an elite college.
15. A person can be not a legacy student.
16. A person can come from a poorer background.
17. A legacy student can come from a richer background.
18. Two students can have the same test scores.

19. If a person is not a legacy student and comes from a poorer background and has the same test scores as a legacy student who comes from a richer background then the person may be more likely to be rejected.
20. I will apply to colleges in a few years.
21. These biases will matter to me.
22. The headline is: The admissions boost of legacy students and richer families.
